definitions: opening in floor, wall, or ceiling with movable cover for access
process of young birds breaking out of eggs or the group of newly hatched young
examples: The sailor climbed down through the cargo hatch carefully
Emergency escape hatches are located throughout the submarine
The entire hatch of chicks emerged within two days
Scientists monitored the turtle hatch on the beach closely

definitions: car with sloped back and hinged rear door that opens upward for cargo access
examples: The compact hatchback fits perfectly in tight parking spaces
She loaded groceries through the hatchback's wide opening easily

definitions: facility where eggs are hatched artificially, especially for fish or poultry
examples: The salmon hatchery releases thousands of young fish annually
Local hatcheries supply most of the region's chicken farms

definitions: small axe with short handle designed for use with one hand
examples: He used a hatchet to split kindling for the campfire
The survival kit included a compact hatchet for emergencies

definitions: artistic technique using parallel lines to create shading and texture
process of breaking out of an egg or time when this occurs
examples: The artist's hatching technique created depth in the portrait
Cross-hatching added shadows to the architectural drawing beautifully
Spring hatching season brings thousands of new birds to life
The hatching process can take several hours to complete

definitions: recently hatched bird, reptile, or fish that is still very young
examples: The sea turtle hatchlings raced toward the ocean waves
Bird hatchlings depend completely on their parents for food

definitions: person who strongly dislikes someone or something, often expressing hostility
examples: Online haters posted negative comments about the new movie
Don't let the haters discourage you from pursuing your dreams

definitions: person who makes or sells hats as their profession or business
examples: The Victorian hatter crafted elegant bonnets for wealthy ladies
Lewis Carroll's Mad Hatter remains a famous fictional character

definitions: quantity of goods transported or obtained at one time
distance to be traveled, especially a long or difficult journey
examples: The fishing boat brought in a massive haul of tuna
Thieves made off with a haul worth thousands of dollars
It's a long haul from New York to Los Angeles
The final haul up the mountain tested everyone's endurance

definitions: commercial transport of goods by road or the business of doing this
examples: The haulage company specializes in refrigerated food transport services
Rising fuel costs have impacted the haulage industry significantly

definitions: act or business of transporting goods, materials, or waste by vehicle
examples: The hauling of construction materials began at dawn today
Waste hauling services operate throughout the metropolitan area daily

definitions: place frequently visited or where someone spends a lot of time
examples: The old bookstore was her favorite haunt during college
Local haunts include cozy cafes and neighborhood bars nearby

definitions: place of safety, refuge, or shelter from danger or trouble
examples: The library became a haven for students during exam week
Wildlife havens protect endangered species from hunting and development

definitions: widespread destruction, damage, or confusion caused by something harmful or disruptive
examples: The hurricane wreaked havoc along the entire eastern coastline
Computer viruses can cause havoc in corporate network systems

definitions: small red berry fruit of the hawthorn tree or shrub
examples: Birds feed on haws throughout the cold winter months
The hedge was heavy with clusters of ripe red haws

definitions: medium to large bird of prey with broad wings and keen eyesight for hunting
examples: A red-tailed hawk circled high above the open field
The hawk swooped down to catch an unsuspecting mouse

definitions: person who sells goods by calling out in the street or going door-to-door
examples: Street hawkers sold fresh fruit at the busy market
The hawker's loud voice attracted customers to his stall

definitions: practice or occupation of selling goods in the street or door-to-door
examples: Hawking newspapers was his first job as a teenager
Street hawking provides income for many urban poor families

definitions: thorny shrub or small tree with white or pink flowers and small red berries
examples: The ancient hawthorn marked the property boundary for centuries
Hawthorn blossoms filled the hedgerow with sweet spring fragrance

definitions: grass or other plants cut and dried for use as animal fodder
examples: Farmers stored hay in the barn for winter feeding
The sweet smell of fresh hay filled the summer air

definitions: field where grass or other plants are grown to be cut and dried for hay
examples: Golden hayfields stretched as far as eyes could see
Workers cut the hayfield under the hot July sun

definitions: large pile or stack of hay, typically cone-shaped and left in fields
examples: Children played hide-and-seek around the tall haystack happily
Finding that document is like searching for needles in haystacks

definitions: something that could cause harm, injury, damage, or other adverse effects
examples: Ice on the road created a serious driving hazard
Safety inspectors identified several fire hazards in the building

definitions: slight obscuration of the atmosphere caused by fine particles of water, dust, or smoke
examples: Morning haze obscured the distant mountain peaks from view
The city skyline disappeared behind a thick summer haze

definitions: shrub or small tree bearing edible nuts in autumn
light golden or greenish-brown color, especially of eyes
examples: Wild hazel grows abundantly in the woodland understory naturally
Squirrels gathered nuts from the hazel bushes all afternoon
Her hazel eyes changed color in different lighting conditions
She chose a soft hazel shade for the living room

definitions: small round edible nut of the hazel tree with hard brown shell
examples: Chocolate-covered hazelnuts make a delicious sweet treat anytime
The recipe calls for one cup of chopped roasted hazelnuts

definitions: dangerous substances requiring special handling, storage, and disposal procedures for safety
examples: The hazmat team responded quickly to the chemical spill
Drivers need special licenses to transport hazmat cargo legally

definitions: band worn around the head to hold hair back or as decoration
examples: Athletes wear headbands to keep sweat from their eyes
The decorative headband matched her formal evening dress perfectly

definitions: count of the number of people present or employed in an organization
examples: The manager took a headcount before starting the meeting
Budget cuts forced a reduction in the department's headcount

definitions: top section of a document, webpage, or data structure containing identifying information
act of hitting a soccer ball with one's head
examples: The document header contains the title and page numbers
Website headers typically include navigation menus and logos
She scored the winning goal with a powerful header
Players practice headers to improve their aerial game skills

definitions: protective or decorative covering for the head including helmets, hats, or caps
examples: Construction workers must wear approved safety headgear on site
Traditional headgear varies significantly across different world cultures

definitions: title at the top of a page, section, or document that indicates content
direction or course along which someone or something moves
examples: Bold headings help readers navigate through long documents easily
Each chapter heading summarizes the main topic clearly
The ship maintained a steady heading despite rough seas
Check your compass heading before starting the hike

definitions: portable light worn on the head for hands-free illumination, especially for outdoor activities
examples: Miners wear headlamps to navigate dark underground tunnels safely
The camping headlamp provides bright light for nighttime activities

definitions: narrow piece of land projecting into the sea from the coastline
examples: Waves crashed dramatically against the rocky headland during storms
The lighthouse stands prominently on the highest headland point

definitions: powerful light at the front of a vehicle for illuminating the road ahead
examples: The car's headlights cut through the thick fog slowly
Remember to turn your headlights on at dusk for safety

definitions: main performer or act at a concert, festival, or entertainment event
examples: The famous rock band was the festival's main headliner
Comedy club headliners perform on Friday and Saturday nights

definitions: chief or leader of a village, tribe, or small community group
examples: The village headman resolved disputes between neighboring families peacefully
Tribal headmen gathered to discuss important community matters together

definitions: male principal or chief administrator of a private school, especially in Britain
examples: The headmaster addressed students at the morning assembly daily
Parents met with the headmaster to discuss academic concerns

definitions: pair of small speakers worn over or in the ears for private listening
examples: Noise-canceling headphones block out distracting background sounds effectively
She wore headphones while studying in the busy library

definitions: vertical space or clearance above one's head, especially in vehicles or buildings
examples: The low ceiling provided barely enough headroom for standing
Tall drivers appreciate extra headroom in larger vehicles considerably

definitions: square of fabric worn over the head and tied under the chin
examples: She wore a colorful headscarf to protect her hair
Traditional headscarves hold cultural significance in many societies worldwide

definitions: set of headphones combined with a microphone for two-way audio communication
examples: Customer service representatives use headsets for hands-free phone calls
Gaming headsets provide immersive audio and clear voice chat

definitions: position or period of being the head or leader of an organization
examples: She assumed headship of the department after years of experience
The headship role involves both administrative and academic responsibilities

definitions: person's mental or emotional state, especially regarding clarity and well-being
space or clearance above something, particularly in containers or rooms
examples: Taking breaks helps maintain positive headspace during stressful projects
Meditation creates the headspace needed for creative thinking
Leave adequate headspace when filling jars for proper sealing
The attic conversion needs more headspace for comfortable living

definitions: stone slab placed at the head of a grave bearing the deceased's name and dates
examples: Fresh flowers adorned the weathered headstone in the cemetery
The old headstone's inscription had faded over many decades

definitions: streams that form the source or beginning of a river system
examples: Scientists studied pollution levels in the river's remote headwaters
Mountain headwaters provide clean water for downstream communities

definitions: forward movement or progress, especially when overcoming difficulties or obstacles
examples: The research team finally made headway after months of setbacks
Strong currents prevented the boat from making much headway

definitions: person who practices healing, especially through alternative or traditional medicine methods
examples: The traditional healer used herbs and ancient remedies effectively
Many cultures respect healers for their knowledge and abilities
